text:
Annual Review of Biochemistry
Volume 65, 1996

INTERRELATIONSHIPS OF THE PATHWAYS OF mRNA

DECAY AND TRANSLATION IN EUKARYOTIC CELLS

Allan Jacobson

Department of Molecular Genetics and Microbiology
University of Massachusetts Medical Schoo!

55 Lake Avenue North

Worcester, MA 01655-0122

e-mail: jacob@umassmed.ummed.edu

Stuart W. Peltz

Department of Molecular Genetics and Microbiology
Robert Wood Johnson Medical Schoo!

University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey
Rutgers University

675 Hoes Lane

Piscataway, NJ 08854

e-mail: pltz@rwja.umdnj.edu

 

KEY WORDS: mRNA stability/degradation/decay, translation, RNA structure, poly(A),
cap; ribosome, RNases, mRNP

Shortened Title: MRNA DECAY IN EUKARYOTES

Send proofs to: Allan Jacobson
Department of Molecular Genetics and Microbiology
University of Massachusetts Medical Schoo!
55 Lake Avenue North
Worcester, MA 01655-0122
Phone: 508 856 2442
Fax: 508 856 5920
e-mail: ajacob@umassmed.ummed.edu

summary: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. MRNA DECAY AND TRANSLATION IN EUKARYOTIC CELLS is published in 1996. The author is Allan Jacobson of the University of Massachusetts Medical Schoo! The book is entitled: "The Pathways of mRNA: A Synthesis and Analysis of Methylation"
